intro: Racosperma lasiocalyx, commonly known as the rough-barked acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It is characterized by its greyish, flaky bark and compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in globular or cylindrical clusters, which are typical of the Acacia genus. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Racosperma lasiocalyx is a hardy plant that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
